definition: (Buddhism) retribution/karma
cause/reason/because
fruit/result/resolute/indeed/if really
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: And then all this earthquake happened, I thought, is that Karma?-when you are not nice that bad things happen to you.
sentences.chinese: 然後地震發生了，我當時就想，這難道是因果報應？

sentences.english: The Buddha has always warned us against karmic retribution.
sentences.chinese: 佛說因果報應絲毫不爽。

sentences.english: Apparently, many people now believe in Karma.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，有很多人相信因果報應。

sentences.english: This is an example of karmic retribution and how inescapable it is.
sentences.chinese: 你們看因果報應何等不爽。

sentences.english: It may serve you, however, to be aware of consequences.
sentences.chinese: 因果報應會使你對做事的後果有所警覺。

sentences.english: Ideal of karma runs through the whole early Chinese translation of Buddhist sutra.
sentences.chinese: 因果報應觀念貫穿了整個初傳漢譯佛經敘事。

sentences.english: There is no prise or punishment in nature, only comeuppance .
sentences.chinese: 自然界中沒有獎賞和懲罰，只有因果報應。

sentences.english: Does karma factor in when a shark snatches up a fish?
sentences.chinese: 當一隻鯊魚掠取一隻魚時是因果報應嗎？

sentences.english: They are not attached to the fruits of karma, and are but one step from Buddhahood.
sentences.chinese: 他們不附上因果報應的果實，而只是成佛的一個臺階。

sentences.english: Muslims, just like Christians are zealously opposed to the concept of karma.
sentences.chinese: 正如基督徒一樣，穆斯林也極度反對因果報應的說法。

sentences.english: It is false to believe that problems are bad karma as a consequence of your past wrong doings.
sentences.chinese: 不要相信問題是你過去錯誤的行爲導致的因果報應。

sentences.english: In nature there are no rewards or punishments; there are consequences.
sentences.chinese: 自然界中沒有獎賞和懲罰，只有因果報應。
佛教徒稱之爲因果報應。

virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to force someone to do something
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to be strict with oneself
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to judge
